boardgame.description:
Fantasy Realms is an acclaimed card game from designer Bruce Glassco that takes seconds to learn: Draw a card from the deck or discard area, discard a card, and try to build the strongest hand by using the best card combos.

Fantasy Realms: The Cursed Hoard expands on the original, adding two new modular expansions that can be added together or separately.

Cursed Items adds a new deck of cards. Players each take one item that they can use whenever they wish to create a powerful effect, like taking double turns, hiding discarded cards, or even skipping your discard phase to keep an extra card! But whenever you use a Cursed Item, it turns into negative points at the end of the game—the more powerful the effect, the more points you lose!

Add three new suits to the game: Develop your realms with Buildings, attract powerful mythical Outsiders, and raise the Undead.

Includes 47 cards.

FANTASTISCHE REICHE: DER VERFLUCHTE SCHATZ - Erweiterung zu Fantastische Reiche Während sich die Reiche auf weitere Auseinandersetzungen vorbereiten, ist etwas Neues angekommen um die Machtverhältnisse zu verändern. Ein Schatz mit uralten Artefakten wurde entdeckt, die so mächtig sind, dass jedes einzelne den Verlauf einer Schlacht verändern kann. Allerdings ist jedes Artefakt mit einem Fluch belegt, der auf jeden fällt, der töricht oder gierig genug ist, seine Macht zu benutzen. Zwischenzeitlich haben die Bewohner der Reiche begonnen, große Burgen, Verliese und mit Untoten gefüllte Krypten zu errichten, um ihre Länder zu stärken. Und von jenseits der Welt der Sterblichen haben sogar die Outsider begonnen, sich von ihren eigenen Sphären aus in den Kampf einzumischen ... Der Verfluchte Schatz ist eine Erweiterung zu Fantastische Reiche und besteht aus zwei Teilen, die dem Grundspiel entweder einzeln oder zusammen hinzugefügt werden können: Karten mit verfluchten Gegenständen, die einen eigenen Stapel bilden und drei neue Kartenfarben, die neue Strukturen und Bewohner repräsentieren und zum Kartenstapel des Grundspiels hinzugefügt werden.
Diese Erweiterung benötig das Grundspiel Fantastische Reiche!
Spielmaterial: 47 Karten 1 Spielregel
Auszeichnungen: Nominiert zum Kennerspiel des Jahres 2021 Bestes Kartenspiel 2021

boardgame.name: ネコナイン (Nekonine)
boardgame.description:
ネコナイン (Nekonine) is a co-operative card game from Japan.

A cat-loving millionaire has decided to create a zoo 'Nyapari Park' that is only for cats. Immediately, they decided to hire a zoo architect, and collected many people to work on it. You are first-class architects assembled for this project. Take a breather and complete the best zoo!

Every round, you’ll choose one of your two hand cards to lay down, and everyone reveals what they laid at the same time. These cards go in the middle, eventually forming a 6x6 grid of 36 cards. Once all the spaces have been filled, the next stage of the game begins.

Now you all have to decide how to make one line to connect the START and the GOAL that also connects nine different animals. If you can do that, you successfully complete the game and everyone wins!

If however, you can’t complete the line or find a way to pass all the animals, or if you can’t find a place to put your card when making the grid, your team fails and everyone loses the game.

猫好きの大富豪がネコ科だけの動物園『ニャパリパーク』を作ることにしました。
早速、動物園建築士を雇うことにしたのですが、
金に物を言わせて何人も集めてしまったから、さぁ大変。
あなた達はこのプロジェクトに集められた一級建築士です。
息を合わせて最高の動物園を完成させましょう！

毎回2枚の手札の内１枚を伏せて全員一斉に公開します。
公開されたカードを中央の場に配置していき、6×6の計36マスが埋まりきったら終了です。
STARTとGOALが繋がるように一筆書きで進んで、
９種類の動物と出会うことが出来ていれば見事完成。全員が勝利します！
もし、その条件を満たせなかったり、途中でカードを置くことが出来なくなれば
プロジェクトは失敗となり、全員が敗北します。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Animal Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The animal kingdom is broad, varied and at times a little weird. Countless costumed freedom fighters draw their powers and inspirations from animals, some possessing the aesthetic bodies of beasts while others draw their trappings and regalia from creatures they seek to emulate. And for those who delve deeper into the zoological there are subtle abilities and strange powers to be unlocked.

This sourcebook contains:

Expanded Animal Descriptors and Animal Features
Offensive Powers: Love Element, Shooting Quills and and two more powers
Defensive Powers: Immunity Factory, Play Possum and Shell
Movement Powers: Hop, Jungle King and Swing
Utility and Other Powers:Animals Spy Network, Dimensional Pouch, Totemic Kinship and more powers

boardgame.name: Necromancy Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromantic powers affect many different facets of life and death and thus encompass a variety of effects. To most people, Necromancy means animating dead corpses as zombies or ghouls, although historically the term referred to communication with spirits of the departed. More broadly, a necromancer can strengthen, weaken, or even extinguish the life force of another creature. The necromancer can also implant a false spark of life in a deceased body, thus allowing it to behave as if alive. Necromancy can wither a limb, stop a heart from beating, rot living flesh, or worse. On a more positive note, Necromancy can boost a person’s life force and ward them from death magic. Necromancy powers can also promote accelerated healing and regeneration, even to the extent of granting immortality. Here are several powers and abilities connected to the art of Necromancy.

This sourcebook contains:

Necromancy Descriptors and Necromancy Features
Offensive Powers: Anti-life Blast,Life Drain, Necrotizing Aura, Summon Undead and more powers
Defensive Powers: Empathic Healing, Phylactery, Wall Of Bones and more powers
Movement, Utility & Other Necromancy Powers: Spirit Seance, Wraith Form and more powers
Four all-new Necromancy Complications

boardgame.name: Tribes and Armies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

TRIBES…

The first portion of this book fills several gaps in the setting information originally presented in the Core Rulebook, namely those associated with the pastoral and tribal populations of the Ancient Near East.

Players who want to create characters who hail from the world beyond the cities’ walls will find a discussion of pastoral existence, new skills, new weapons (like the lasso and the throw stick), and tribal magic items. Additionally, for groups using the optional Feats system, this book includes several feats appropriate to migratory life in the arid world of Mesopotamia.

…and ARMIES

The second half details the organization and equipage of a city-state’s armed forces, and describes rules for adjudicating mass combat situations, along with associated tactics and a method by which player characters may help or harm opposed units.
boardgame.rpg: Babylon on Which Fame and Jubilation are Bestowed (1st Edition)

boardgame.name: Twenty-Five Personalities of the Kingdom of Babylon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need the best-made leather armor in the whole city of Babylon? Go see the leatherworker Bahli-bašti, but make sure to bring your purse.

Need to research a Sumerian ritual, not performed since the Deluge? If anyone knows where to find more information on it, it’ll be Amat-Marduk, a naditum familiar with the archives of Esagil.

When a wealthy awilum is found dead near the Market Gate, will players be able to track down the bloodthirsty fortune-teller Nanna-girgal, or will the incredulous judge Rip’a-malik attempt to arrest them first?

How is the moneylender Lawi-la-Addu implicated in the night-time burglaries of the acrobat Ana-Ayya-uzni, and what, if anything, does his latest spate of bad investments have to do with the criminal alewife Ruttum?

Twenty-Five Personalities of the Kingdom of Babylon supplies twenty-five pregenerated, non-player characters appropriate to a fantasy roleplaying game set in the world of 18th Century BCE Mesopotamia. These individuals are not kings, queens or other powerful, socially remote officials whom players are unlikely to affect through their actions. Instead, they are interesting, unique personalities whose involvement can add a bit of flavor to adventures in Mesopotamia, or around whom gamemasters can create whole scenarios.

As with our previous material for Babylon On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed, all game mechanics are presented using BFJB’s “classless” d20 system. However, this material is easily adapted to any system of your choice, or to other fantastic campaigns set at other times and places in the Ancient Near East.
boardgame.rpg: Babylon on Which Fame and Jubilation are Bestowed (1st Edition)

boardgame.name: Babylon On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is no king who is strong on his own.
Ten or fifteen kings are following Ḫammu-rapi, the master of Babylon,
the same for Rīm-Sîn, the master of Larsa,
the same for Ibal-pi-El, the master of Ešnunna,
the same for Amud-pi-El, the master of Qaṭna.
Twenty kings are following Yarim-Lim, the master of Yamḫad.
- A letter from Itūr-Asdu of Mari, to vassals of King Zimri-Lim, written ca. 1769 BCE.

Over 3,700 years ago, Hammu-rapi reigned in Babylon. Known today for his law code, this Amorite king took a minor city-state located on a branch of the Euphrates and created an empire which rivaled any the world had yet seen.

Babylon On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed is a roleplaying game set during the 25th year of Hammu-rapi’s reign. Whether players choose to situate their game in historic Mesopotamia, or in some fantastic variant, BFJB gives players and gamemasters the tools needed to experience the cultural milieu and personalities of Babylon in the eighteenth century BCE.

Now updated with a simpler, faster ruleset, this new edition includes significantly more information on the peoples and cultures of the Old Babylonian Era. The gazetteer has also been substantially expanded from the first edition, and includes notes on 29 additional cities of the Ancient Near East. In addition to this book, a group needs only paper, several six-sided dice, and their imagination to play.
boardgame.rpg: Babylon On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed (2nd Edition)

boardgame.name: The Cursed Colony of Meslamtaea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four hundred and fifty years before the reign of Ḫammu-rapi of Babylon, Naram-Sîn of Akkade destroyed the colony of Kār-Nergal. Abandoned by its people, silt soon clogged the colony’s main irrigation channel. The resulting flood swamped the city’s broken remains.

Recently, descendants of Kār-Nergal’s survivors have returned to reclaim the colony, now situated in the midst of a fetid marsh. Afflicted by a centuries-old curse, the people of Kār-Nergal are led by fanatic clergy. These priests, who worship an ancient aspect of the underworld god Meslamtaea, have commanded their agents to gather captives and slaves for the high-priestess’s grand project.

Day after day, this workforce labors at a great excavation. Informed by god-sent visions, the high-priestess believes a powerful artifact lies buried here — one, she hopes, will allow her to disrupt the petty kingdoms of Mesopotamia, thereby fueling Kār-Nergal’s return to significance.

The Cursed Colony of Meslamtaea is the first adventure setting for the Second Edition of Babylon, On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed, a roleplaying game set in the world of Ḫammu-rapi of Babylon.
boardgame.rpg: Babylon On Which Fame and Jubilation Are Bestowed (2nd Edition)

boardgame.name: ElevatorUp
boardgame.description:
ElevatorUp is the brand NEW kid-created, kid-designed, kid-marketed, and kid-shipped (yes, they're all me) card game! Elevator Up will keep you smiling through Ups, Downs, and even getting Stuck!

ElevatorUp is fast-paced, easy-to-learn, and never gets old. Uno, GoFish, and other classic card games begin to become monotonous. Luckily, ElevatorUp provides a much needed innovation.

It is perfect for Travel, Camp, Sleepovers, Parties, Game-Nights, and any other occasion for a card game.

THEME:
An elevator going Up, Down, and sometimes Stuck in a building!

HOW TO PLAY:
Object - Be the first one out of cards.

Setup - Give each player 3 cards face down on the table (no one is allowed to look at these), 2 cards face up on the table (everyone can see these), and 3 cards for their hand (only that player can look at those).

Gameplay - There are three sections of the game: Beginning: Hand Cards, Middle: Face Up Cards, End: Face Down Cards.
When it is your turn, you must discard a card that is either an equal/higher floor than the previously played card or a special card. If there is no previously played card, then you can play any card. Continue taking turns and discarding cards until someone does not have a special card or an equal/higher floor, meaning they must pick up the entire discard pile and add it to their hand. Players must keep at least 3 cards in their hand at all times, replenishing from the remainder of the deck. The special cards, including New Building, Stuck, Penthouse, Door Closed, and Down to the Lobby, throw exciting twists and turns.
Once the deck has been completely used up and players finish playing the cards in their hand, they move onto the face up cards, leaving them for all to see. The rules are the same for this section, but their hand can be seen by other players. Once they've gotten rid of their face up cards, it is time to play their face down cards. When it is their turn, the player will flip a card onto the discard pile. If it is an equal/higher floor or a special card, then shout "YAY" or any other celebratory exclamation. If it does not, then put on your game face and pick up the entire discard pile, adding it to your hand. The first player out of cards WINS!

description from publisher

boardgame.name: Path of the Gladiator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Path of the Gladiator is a primal path for Barbarians that allows them to enter a rampage aiming to impress and inspire crowds or shake the resolve of multiple enemies.

Cutting down a beast set upon them in an illegal underground fighting pit, or beating an equal warrior into submission in an organized gladiatorial ring, these barbarians are vicious fighters who steel their rage and focus it into a performative, overwhelming enemy in combat. They excel at engaging multiple enemies and think on their feet with experience unlike other barbarians. Their steel, smarts and strength come together to form a savage warrior the people may idolize.

boardgame.name: Subclass Pack I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains 14 subclasses for use in 5th Edition D&d, which can be utilized in any setting. These classes are based in the Somnus Domina setting featured in Nat19's Vestige of Ophiuchus. These classes focus on adding new options and altered playstyles. Most or all of the classes are available to purchase individually, but purchasing this pack saves more than 50% off of the total price of all of them.

This pack contains the following subclasses

Barbarian - Path of the Gladiator
Bard - [College of Drifting Echoes]
Cleric - [Stillness Domain]
Druid - [Circle of Guardians]
Fighter - Brawler
Fighter - Red Lion Knight
Fighter - Way of Blue Metal
Monk - [ Twisthound Style]
Paladin - [ The Oath of Authority]
Ranger - Grey Arrow
Rogue - Dreg Letter
Sorcerer - Eidolic Cosmologus
Warlock - Pact of the Eidolos
Wizard - Crucible Mage

boardgame.name: The Red Lion Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Lion Knight is a Fighter Archetype that focuses on improving melee critical hits and using their actions to inspire their team to movement and greater action.

Knights of The Land Away, raised to be valiant and just. They are natural commanders and warriors. Red Lion Knights excel at leading others into battle and representing their noble houses with authority and tact. Characterized by their use of heavy armor and spear-tipped standards featuring their family crest they often ride into battle inspiring those behind them.

boardgame.name: The Grey Arrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grey Arrow archetype offers abilities that specialize in punishing spellcasters and creatures benifiting from magical effects.

Grey Arrows are taught by members of an old order of mage hunters. Originally wardens who helped to keep the threat of magic at bay, their order has all but fallen apart. Outside certain splinter groups they hunt individually. They know techniques that target a mage's connection to the weave, and cause their control over its power to falter.

boardgame.name: The Eidolic Cosmologus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The eidolic cosmologus is a sorcerous origin that harnesses damage taken as charges used for metamagic or unique features.

A sorcerer with the Eidolic Cosmologus origin is one has a bloodline that eventually reaches back to the Eidolons of Somnus Domina. Before ascending to become the Eidolons, they twelve were mortal beings. When blessed with divinity and raised up to the status of god-hood, those related to them were also touched by a fragment of their power. Those who have their blood in their veins or whose soul somehow was touched or blessed by an Eidolon can manifest unique powers that make them one with some element of the earth and connect them to the cosmos.

boardgame.name: The Brawler
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Brawler fighter archetype is a set of options and weapons that allow for a more physical fist-fighter that trades extra attacks for possible extra options.

A hand-to-hand fighter who relies on their own strength over swords and spears. They specialize in physical combat techniques that pin down and immobilize opponents, shifting their focus. They are never unarmed as long as they have their hands and feet.

boardgame.name: Way of Blue Metal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Way of Blue Metal fighter archetype is a versatile subclass that uses chakra points to perform features they choose from a list at set levels.

Within the divided world of Somnus Domina, a divided school of swordsmanship emerged. A lone elven swordsman turned inward, finding peace and harnessing his mental energy to utilize in his swordsmanship. Eventually he would infuse his sword with his own pure spiritual energy, and the result turned the blade blue... so was born the way of blue metal.

Those who follow the way of blue metal use chakra to unlock supernatural abilities within themselves. They study teachings passed down from their forebearers and sharpen their mind to accomplish techniques similar to those a monk may perform. Using this energy they can find weaknesses in enemy armor, swiftly weave through enemies, strike from afar with their blade and achieve bursts of heightened activity.

boardgame.name: In the Labyrinth (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters and Treasure!

Old-school dungeon-crawling is at its best in The Fantasy Trip. This book covers roleplaying, character creation and experience, and advanced magic and combat rules for players who already have Melee and Wizard. First released in 1980 and unavailable for decades, In the Labyrinth is back in a new, expanded, and improved edition for daring dungeon-delvers!

boardgame.name: Death Test & Death Test 2
Death Test (2nd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mighty Thorsz is hiring guards. But the test is a killer. You have to make it through his labyrinth full of traps, monsters, and other would-be guards!

These adventures can be played by a single player or a group of up to four. You can even play with a GM, but you don’t need one . . . these are “programmed adventures” that take you through the labyrinth. Your choices – and whether you conquer or flee – determine what paragraph you go to next. Until you succeed, gaining rewards and honor . . . or lose.

Losers die.

Death Test is 24 pages of murderous goodness. Death Test 2, the sequel, is twice as long and at least twice as deadly. These games use the Melee map and the Melee and Wizard rules.

boardgame.name: Black It Out
boardgame.description:
Black It Out is a fun roll and write game that is extremely simple yet offers great tactical decisions.

Playing in roughly 15 minutes (with no set up time) Black It Out is ideal for families, as a warm up at the start of a games night or as a 'one last game' before the night is over.

The aim of the game is to be the person who has 'blacked out' the most of their grid.

On a turn you will roll three dice, total two of them which will give you a shape and then draw that shape on to your grid to 'black it out'!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals Expandable Card Game
boardgame.description:
Vampire: The Masquerade Rivals Expandable Card Game puts you in control of a coterie of vampires who vie for control of the city of San Francisco. Through dominating mortals, using their political influence, and clashing with their rivals in the streets in the dark of the night, you'll gather your allies and face off against one or more other players as you seek to push your agenda.

In Vampire: The Masquerade Rivals Expandable Card Game, each player plays with a Deck of Cards featuring a Clan from Vampire: The Masquerade Lore.

At the beginning of each player's turn, a new challenge or objective will be revealed in the streets. Each player gets two actions on their turn such as draw or play cards, recruit vampires, claim a title, or attack! The other clans will oppose you for dominance in the streets or directly in haven.

Defeat your rival, or gain 13 Agenda Points to win the game and claim dominance over San Francisco.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Best Laid Plans of Gnomes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gnomes are famous for their magic, and their tinkering, and their magical tinkering! But sometimes they don't know when to stop. Rolisa Silverspring has requested immediate assistance when something in her factory has gone awry.

A Four Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: From Every Winter, Spring
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An elderly gentleman asks a group of green adventurers to escort him to a fountain of youth. What they discover will leave them rethinking their own lives.

A Two- to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: The Chi Directive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stories of Muckflash Marsh have been told for decades—deep whispered voices and floating lights. Recently the lights have brightened, and the voices turned higher pitched. A young woman has brought tales of evil doings at the march and a plea for aid.

Mischief of Profiteering Series, Part One.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st to 4th Level.

Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: The Cause of All Life's Problems
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An unknown sickness has struck the Mulmaster refugee camp. The Painbearers of Ilmater are stumped and need brave adventurers to seek the wisdom of an old couple in the Cormanthor Forest. Perhaps their ancient wisdom will provide a clue to a cure.

Mischief of Profiteering Series, Part Two.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st to 4th Level.

Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Breaking Bes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An illness affecting the Mulmaster refugees has reached epidemic levels. Magical treatments are effective but limited. An antidote can be found in a stronghold in Minauros. The imp Pipyap has agreed to help you gain entry...for just a tiny favor...really.

Final installment to Mischief of Profiteering series.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Characters of 1st to 4th Level.

Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Six Swords Out of Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A prisoner with knowledge vital to the safeguarding of Faerûn is held in Maladomini, the seventh of the Nine Hells. Retrieving her is a blood-tinted guideed tour of all of this plane has to offer.

An eight-hour adventure for tier 3 characters, optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Where Devils Fear to Tread
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The commander’s soul has been cast through the portal into the Death Dells. You must follow into the lair of Yeenoghu and rescue the commander before the Beast of Butchery devours him!

Part Two of the Red Hunt series of adventures.

A Four to Six-Hour Adventure for 17th through 20th Level Characters.

boardgame.name: Fang and Claw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zariel’s deputy, General Everbleed, has fled with Commander De La Reue’s soul only to be captured by Yeenoghu’s brood! Dara implores you to recover the commander, though his soul has been taken to a most unusual place.

Part One of the Red Hunt series of adventures.

A Four to Six-Hour Adventure for 17th through 20th Level Characters.

boardgame.name: d66 personalities - Thirty-six Interesting Personalities for your Non-Player Characters
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

How many Non-Player Characters do your Players meet in your Tiny Dungeons adventures? What are they like? Do you think of their personalities before they start their interaction with your players? Do their roles usually have a significant impact on your whole adventure? Do they make your game enjoyable?

This d66 chart system wants to give you an easy tool to create interesting Non-Player Characters personalities for your Tiny Dungeons’ games. Those personalities will add color and life to your adventures, and will help your job as a great Game Master!

boardgame.name: Gatewalkers
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





You are a Gatewalker, the chosen one, who can go through the gate and explore the other side. Team up with up to 4 players to face the team-based survival. Fight terrifying monsters, survive extreme weather conditions, do the job ordered by the mysterious Guild, and what is the most important… stay alive!

Explore many procedurally generated worlds with unique terrain, plants, and creatures. Discover new resources and crafting materials. Face various environmental hazards: toxic atmosphere, lack of oxygen, terrifying darkness, penetrating cold, and much more…

Each world type introduces a unique survival mechanic that makes players adapt. Finding food, water or wood to start a fire may be impossible to do. Plan carefully what to bring with you on the expedition, no one realy knows what is on the other side of the Gate.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Cha'alt: Fuchsia Malaise
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cha'alt: Fuchsia Malaise is a continuation of the Cha'alt campaign setting and dungeon extravaganza. Eldritch, gonzo, science-fantasy, post-apocalyptic awesomeness compatible with the original RPG all the way up to 5th edition.

In this book, I detail the city of A'agrybah, along with various adventuring locales - the largest being an offworlder high-tech facility called Elysium. Lots of gorgeous maps, random tables, NPCs, magic items, and monsters.

boardgame.name: Embarcadero
boardgame.description:
San Francisco, 1850. The Gold Rush is in full swing. Ships stream steadily in San Francisco Bay, brimming with would-be treasure hunters. Anchored off the coast of the boomtown lies a flotilla of abandoned vessels, their crews long since taken by gold fever. A few business moguls stake their claims on these derelict ships, towing them into the harbor to house their growing empires. Over time, this wharfside district, known as the embarcadero, would become the very heart of business enterprise in the thriving port city.

In Embarcadero, players step into the shoes of these savvy entrepreneurs. Build San Francisco on the hulls of these abandoned vessels and carve out a foothold in the city council. Do you have what it takes to rule the waterfront?

The game takes place over three rounds. In each round, players take turns playing cards and placing tiles to take control of wharves to earn points and influence.

—description from publisher

From publisher blurb:

This upgraded version of the Saving Fang solo has been adjusted for use with dT&T and has new art and additional GM material. We've also included the T&T Mini-Rules so you can play this without having the rulebook.

What its about: On your first visit to Khosht, you meet up with Cherry, the legendary swashbuckling she-devil. Her friend Fang has just been taken prisoner by ghouls outside of town. Will you aid Cherry and Slather the Troll rescue Fang from a fate worse than death? There's also plenty of treasure and power to be found on this mission, assuming you can survive the Pits of Morgul!

There is also the Pits of Morgul GM adventure which give you some information about Khosht and a map of the Pits of Morgul and stats on the main characters and creatures you might meet there. This makes a great adventure you can run as a gm. You can also use information from the solo adventure to enhance play as the two take place in the same locations.

This solo and gm advenutre is perfect for new players and a great place to start if you want to start with some lower level characters. The mini-rules even include 4 pre-rolled characters.

boardgame.name: The Brecken Vale Games
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Brecken Vale Games - an exciting new Super Premium Adventure.

One hundred years ago, when the Brecken Vale was ravaged by the evil dragon Ebonscar, the villages of the Brecken Vale united to bring down this terrible threat. To celebrate their victory, commemorate their collaboration, and prepare for any future threats, the villages of the Brecken Vale created an annual tournament.

Join the villages of Adestikay, Alpineland, Greenfalls, Hollocia, and Willowsdell as they strive to win the Brecken Vale Games! Meet the young heroes who represent their communities. Swing your sword in a sparring match, brave the snows in the Alpine Relay, and perfect your butterfly stroke in the Rescue Relay!

The Brecken Vale Games provides a new way to play within the Hero Kids system. Players form teams or use one provided to compete in a variety of sporting events–mini-games that combine standard Hero Kids game play with new, unique challenges. The Brecken Vale Games can be played in four modes: From quick, individual competitions between player teams to a cooperative adventure campaign over several sessions.

This huge product delivers hours of fun and replayability!

What makes this unique adventure Super Premium? 67 pages of Hero Kids fun, including:


20 New Hero Cards and Minis
6 Sporting Events (mini-games)
5 Village Histories
3 New Items (medals!)
Lore of the Games
Closing Ceremonies
Story Hooks
GM Cheat Sheet
Maps, Tokens, and Score Cards
High Resolution and Printer Friendly Versions
Poster Print Option (large maps)

boardgame.name: Murano: Complete Edition
boardgame.description:
The Complete Edition contains Murano, Murano: Promo Cards and Murano: The Christmas Tree packaged inside the box.

About the game:

Murano the game is set in Murano, a small group of seven islands near Venice that's well-known by tourists for its glassmaking. As in Venice, the islands of Murano are separated by canals, so gondolas and transportation are at the heart of this game.

The game board depicts the islands of Murano, with the islands being divided up into building sites and walkways. Surrounding the islands is a series of action spaces, with gondolas being present in some number of them at the start of play. On a turn, you move one of the gondolas in the direction of play to an empty space, then take the action shown there. You can't pass another gondola while moving or land in an occupied space, but for a coin you can move a gondola that's in front of the gondola you want to move, and you can pay to move multiple gondolas, if needed.

Some actions place shops on the islands, with shops coming in different types. You mark a shop to show ownership, and when tourists show up later, they will shop at various stores depending on their proximity and the goods they offer. You also need to take actions to move your personal gondolas to islands so that you can take actions there.

Why are you doing all of this activity? To score victory point cards in hand, and actions on the board will let you gain additional VP cards to give you direction to your actions or let you profit from what you've already done.

You can also use some of the buildings to create glassworks, and those glassworks come into play on the VP cards, through tourist sales, and via an action space shown at the bottom of the game board image that lets you sell different types of glass for money.

boardgame.name: The Least of Spells
boardgame.description:
We Can't All Be Archmages

Gamers love earth-shattering magic – but that isn't, as the saying goes, "all she wrote." Many fine stories feature apprentice wizards, or cocky dabblers in arcane arts they don't understand; interesting fantasy worlds often depart from the GURPS assumption that magic-users are born gifted; and even a lot of unsubtle, high-powered hack 'n' slash posits that almost anybody can learn minor spells on the side.

Workarounds to this in the GURPS Magic rules amount to "make Magery really common" or "increase the mana level." GURPS Magic: The Least of Spells offers an alternative approach: "assume there's easy, low-powered magic that nearly anybody can learn." It consists of 77 such spells spread across the 24 standard colleges, the game mechanics that go with them, and advice on using it all in your campaign.

Little tricks are often the best ones!

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Which Side?
boardgame.description:
CONTEXT
At the beginning of the 20th century, capitalism and the nation-state are in full swing, workers have it hard: Working conditions; Work time; Wages; Unsanitary housing; everything systematically leans in favor of employers.

Yet since May 1, 1886 and the Haymarket Massacre, workers have tried to organize and resist, supported by a new generation of increasingly committed anarchist and union activists.

The scenario of "Which Side are you on?" takes place in New York, during the winter of 1910-1911 and stages homes of workers who try to survive and organize themselves to take control of the means of production before the employers become too powerful. It takes place between two events revealing the working conditions of textile workers:

- On November 25, 1910, a fire occurred at a four-story factory in Newark, New Jersey. 25 factory workers, mostly young women, died.
- On March 25, 1911, exactly four months after the Newark event, a fire engulfs the 8th, 9th, and 10th floors of the Asch Building, occupied by the Triangle Waist Company, causing the death of 146 workers.

THE GAME
"Which Side are you on?" is a historical and cooperative survival game that simulates the struggle of the workers in New York between the years 1910 and 1911; for their survival; against employer offensives; for the control of the means of production.

Workers pose and resource collection mechanisms allow for a fluid game; and a system of elements with their historical context, which facilitates immersion.

This game will particularly appeal to players who like adversity, cooperation, immersion, History ... and perseverance!

HOW TO PLAY
1-A game lasts 10 turns. Each turn, the bosses carry out offensives through cards drawn at random. These cards establish temporary or permanent mini-rules against players.

2-You will be playing a family or a small group of people living together. Each member is one of your "workers" and has one action to perform per turn.

3-Each turn, you send your "workers" to the Tiles of New York in order to: a / work and be paid in order to pay your rent, your food and the expenses of the struggle; b / work in political places to cause agitation, strikes or sabotage.

4-Then, you will use agitation, strikes and sabotage to fight the bosses offensives against your rights.

5-With the added agitation, evolve the New York Tiles to make them more worker friendly; complete 6 objectives and take control of the means of production BEFORE the bosses take control of everything and even leave you enough to survive.

6-Be careful, each turn you will have to draw: a / misfortune cards which will make everyone's life even more difficult; b / incident cards which will strike the player who will have the most Risk (obtained according to the work), Police Threat (obtained by causing agitation) OR the least healthy.

7-You could end up with workers in prison, injured, or sick. Which will lower your possibilities for your next turn.

HOW TO WIN
1-Victory: Take control of New York's means of production by purchasing 6 objectives with your resources.
2-You lose if you fail to pay the cost of your living or if the bosses reach turn 10.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Queen Killer
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Queen Killer is an one-shot adventure integrated with a mini-scenario to be played with Fate Accelerated RPG system. It is set in an Industrial/Urban fantasy scenario with lots of references to classical Rock and Metal bands.

The Kingdom of Dark Throne has been ruling over the continent with tyranny for ages and the current Queen manages to be even stricter with her policies, to the point that she’s got the nickname of Iron Maiden.

A group of rebels called Quiet Rioters in Toxic City has an one in a lifetime chance to slay the queen as they’ve heard rumors about a secret meeting that will take place in their city, taking the queen away from the protection of the Paradise City, capital of the kingdom.

The rebels don’t know much about the event but they know some people that do.

boardgame.name: Ironclads: The American Civil War at Sea 1861-65
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Dawn of Iron: The American Civil War at Sea, a game of naval combat, set during American Civil War (1861-1865). The Civil War is famously known for its land battles, such as Shiloh, Vicksburg, and the Peninsular Campaign, however all of these examples were profoundly impacted by the presence of naval forces. While many think of the war's naval campaigns as a static blockade around the Confederacy, the truth of the matter is that it was actually just as desperate, bloody affair just like the other aspects of the conflict. From the coastal regions of Virginia and the muddy rivers of the Mississippi Valley to the far flung freezing waters of Alaska's Bering Strait, Union and Confederate navies fought for dominance.

Dawn of Iron puts you in command of a Civil War-era vessel, or a full squadron of them. You will have many of the ships available that fought in the conflict, so assemble your fleet, sortie out to engage the enemy, and send them to the bottom!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: How Game Are You? Original Edition
boardgame.description:
This 'ORIGINAL EDITION' is named so because its the first of the Question card format games, following the previous 'COUPLES INTIMACY EDITION' board game.

In this ORIGINAL EDITION, questions are ranked A, B or C depending on whether you want a quick lite game (A's) or deeper questions (C's) or play A,B,C in order.

Player one asks the selected question of the other player(s), and they answer with the total Truth, or a total Lie. Player one has to guess is it Truth or a Lie and gains a point if they identified it correctly. This can also be played as a drinking game where the wrong guess means you take a drink. Suitable for 2-8 players 16+y/o for normal games and older if its a drinking game.

The game can also be played co-cooperatively, where all questions are Truth and take turns to ask the other(s). Lose a point for no answer given or you want to skip. boardgame.name: Her Lie I Tried To Believe
boardgame.description:
For reasons he doesn’t even know about, Tim has always felt hatred toward her. It could be because of her eyes. It could be because of her smile. Or it could simply be because she’s alive. The underlying causes can sometimes come from unexpected depths after all.

The only thing he knows for sure is that he saw her as a rival.

To defeat her. To humiliate her. To destroy her. For the first 16 years of his life, he drew breaths for those reasons alone.

But then… nothing. They eventually went their separate ways, as change is the inevitability that comes with those younger years.

Confronted with this sudden change, Tim had no other choice but to keep on moving forward, and finally adapted to a dull, productive lifestyle, forgetting even the fact that he once bore such animosity inside of him.

Until he met her again, that is.

Her Lie I Tried To Believe is a short kinetic novel about the persisting hatred of a boy throughout his life, the destructive relationship that was born from it, and the consequences he had to face as a direct result.

boardgame.name: Lucha Wars
boardgame.description:
Lucha Wars is a two to eight-player dice game, based on the popular world of professional Mexican wrestling, or "Lucha Libre" (a.k.a. free fighting). The game is a new variation with new content to Luchador! Mexican Wrestling dice.
Each player selects a Luchador wrestling character to play and rolls their Grapple Dice to try to either reduce their opponent/s life points to zero to win by a knock-out (KO) or hold the opponent down on the mat for a "count of three" to win by a pin.
Each wrestler has individual Life levels, Pinnable level, and Combo Attack zones. Also, they each have their own Special Attacks that can be used during a match by rolling their Special Attack Die.

Players begin by each rolling their own set of five 'wrestling dice' at the same time, trying to ensure that they land in, or touching the wrestling ring. The results of HITs, DODGES, and MISS rolled are played off against each other with DODGES being re-rolled once which can also be used to target their opponent/s dice. The player with the highest Hits is the winner for that round and the loser takes the difference in damage off their Life track.

Additionally, the winner records the victory by moving their counter up one tile on their Special Attack Track.
The Special Attack track allows a player to do their Special Attack, attempt to PIN an opponent, attack using the Combo Die and attack with a Weapon (Weapons Match).

If a player has reached the PIN tile on their Special Attack Track, the 'three count' begins against their opponent. The player being pinned has three attempts to save, using four of their five wrestling dice or lose the match.

In a tag-team match, players have the choice of trying to tag-out to regain slight strength, but it can also cost them... if they fail to tag and get dragged back into the ring by their eager opponent.

In the Weapons match, four Weapons Tokens are placed face-down in each of the four corners of the wrestling ring. Once a player moves their token to the tile on their Special Attack Track that shows a Weapon, it allows them to take a random Weapon Token and use that Weapon against an opponent at the beginning of any new round. This will often involve dexterity rolls with dice.

The Ladder match is a two-player game about which player gets their wrestler standee to the top of the ladder first to win the match. The game also includes a Changing Alliances match and Cage Match rules.

—description from the designer

Players must balance their inventory of Food, Gas and Money at checkpoints and points of interest from Las Vegas through the infamous Highway 375 or Extraterrestrial Highway. boardgame.name: The TimeKeeper
boardgame.description:
The TimeKeeper is a hand management card based game for 2-5 players, featuring a unique two-piece rotational board. Players collect crystal cards of different values to power their TimeKeeper device. Wisdom scrolls can be used as variable player powers to alter gameplay. Time Keys are used to move the TimeKeeper device forward or backwards in time, altering the relationship of the crystal cards values to the board. The game ends when the first person completes their device, but the winner is the player with the highest value cards for each of the different crystal types.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Second Great War at Sea: Tropical Storm
boardgame.description:
Second Great War at Sea: Tropic of Capricorn told the story of a war that never happened: a naval conflict between Argentina, Chile and Brazil breaking out in 1940 as part of the world-wide Second Great War. Tropical Storm picks up the story, as a German squadron arrives to aid the Brazilians and the naval war continues.

The Second Great War is our alternative-history setting, in which American President Woodrow Wilson’s attempt to mediate an end to the fighting succeeds, leaving the great empires intact to fight again a generation later. War spreads around the globe, eventually engulfing the empires’ South American allies.

Like all the other Second Great War at Sea games and books, Tropical Storm uses the rules from Second World War at Sea and is fully compatible with that series’ historical games.

Tropical Storm includes a map (covering Argentina’s central coast) and 80 new die-cut, silky smooth playing pieces (60 “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones). Thirty new scenarios move the story along, and put even more hot battleship action on your gaming table.

Tropical Storm is not a complete game. You’ll need a copy of Tropic of Capricorn (and only Tropic of Capricorn) to play its scenarios.

Press kit

The SIGIL Megawad is free download created by John Romero for the original 1993 DOOM®. It contains nine single-player and nine deathmatch levels. boardgame.name: Shaka Shredders
boardgame.description:
Shaka Shredders: Rivals is a 2-player craftable card game made of interchangeable magnetized components. The game set comes as two separate decks, each representing a tribe. Players will choose a tribe, find an opponent, then draw a hand of 5 cards each. Players take turns drawing a card, playing up to one card from their hand, and making up to one character exchange per turn. This process is called a "swap" and it "levels up" your cards from rank 1 all the way to rank 4.

To win, earn 20 "CHEER" points by challenging your opponent's cards to Trick Battles that appeal to each tribe's fan base. CHEER is earned whenever you challenge your opponent but they fail to defend. They can defend their turf by matching up their own Tricks against yours, but the lowest scoring Trick will be removed from the game and placed into the discard pile.

Strategic play involves knowing when to challenge and when to defend. It also requires smart swapping to maximize the Ranks of your characters while preparing for counter play. There are 3 types of cards: Tricks that score points, Assists that boost Tricks, and Disses that remove other cards from play.

boardgame.name: Everything Lost
boardgame.description:
Everything Lost is a thematic solo game set in an apocalyptic world in which you are the hero.

One day, you wake up. Like always, the first thing you do is open your curtains to look outside......to find out this day is different. You are stunned. Everything is lost. Your town is destroyed. Roads are gone, rubble is everywhere. Most buildings which are still standing look like skeletons. A few people are out there, stumbling goalless between the chaos, like... zombies.

What is this? What happened? For how long have you been sleeping? You open your fridge. The smell! You close it fast. You feel a cold breeze. You look up. You notice almost half of your roof is missing. You’re shaking. It’s freezing. You start to feel a primal drift. You realize no one is here to help you. You have got to take care of things. Danger is out there. Instinctively you grab a tool from your toolbox and go outside.

A game of Everything Lost consists of 4 chapters. In every chapter you choose 1 (out of 2 or 3) missions to play. Each mission starts at your home, the centre of town. You explore the 4 sectors surrounding your home. When you survive all 4 missions, you win. Search for food, repair your roof, steal a bulldozer and ram a warehouse, save survivors from a mall, eliminate a gang of outlaws, etc.

Next time you may follow a different path, by choosing different missions.

On your map you draw the city with your pencil as the game progresses. Your 5 white dice represent your energy. Use them well. If you spend a lot of dice, your chances will increase, but you will run out of dice fast. When you do, you will need to rest to get them back. This is risky. The mob will grow and events will force you to make difficult choices.

Break in buildings to find useful things and weapons, search the rubble, fight zombies and look for survivors. Convince them to join your team. Get more experienced and unlock new skills and actions. Eventually you will craft new weapons, climb buildings and attack the mob from above, or ambush them. Who’s the boss now? But only if you are a real survivor. Will you earn yourself one of the 4 available nicknames? Good luck!

—description from the designer

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Blood Games 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

In the beginning, Homo Sapiens was a prey species. Hunted by the creatures of darkness, we had no culture, and only the most primitive of tools. We were brought out of Africa, our homeland, into strange places, where we evolved to fit the land. Our terror, the Vampires, fed on us, as did the Lycanthropes and the other Creatures of Night. They hunted herds of us as wild animals, and they exacted their price in blood.

Blood Games 4 is set in the real world, anywhere from the Renaissance to today.

In Blood Games 4, the players play the role of individuals from different walks of life who have joined forces to fight the Creatures of the Night.

Religion is vital to the game. Many of the paths are religious in nature, and the reality of some greater being or beings helping humanity is a central fact. Blood Games is not, however, tied to any one religion.

Blood Games 4 is about courage, self sacrifice, and desperate heroism with no hope of reward.

boardgame.name: Leaves from the Circle: Druids and Rangers for 5E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover new druid and ranger archetypes!

Like prior entries Tome of the Pact and Book of the Path provided new options for 5th Edition warlocks and barbarians, Leaves from the Circle brings exciting new subclass options for the druid and ranger classes. Inside these pages, you'll find:

Circle of the Augur: Read the omens across many oracular disciplines, from tea leaves to organs.
Circle of Rot: Cover yourself with the stripped flesh of fallen foes, gaining monstrous protection and unsettling powers
Circle of the Starless Void: Choose an eldritch transformation and whisper madness as you emulate alien life from beyond the stars.
Circle of the Yoke: Aid your community with this agrarian Circle focused on help and home.
Light Cavalry: Your ranger darts between foes, leaving them hobbled and exposed to your allies' strikes.
Thunderstone: Unleash the power of the storm as your ranger electrifies opponents.
Trail Keeper: Bring aid and comfort to your companions in the midst of battle and hard days in the wild.
Vermin Dancer: Even death won't free you from the bond you share with the rats and flies.
Weapon Weaver: Become a relentless barrage of deadly strikes when you become this master of two-weapon fighting.


In addition, explore a selection of new magic items and two d20 trinket tables for your druid and ranger characters!

boardgame.name: Cascadia Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After starting your adventuring careers, you arrive in Runnymede a small village. A man in the center of the community is spouting something and you quickly discovered a child has gone missing. The citizens are reluctant to send the city watch out and that gives you the opening you to jumpstart your careers!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for a group of mid-level (4th level) adventurers.

boardgame.name: Genship
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Genship is a role-playing game about people living on a generation ship: A spaceship whose designed mission spans the lifetimes of many generations of its inhabitants. Each generation is in charge of keeping things going smoothly for the generations to follow, making lives for themselves and choices that may have consequences for the future of humanity. The game focuses on a few critical events that happen over the ship's lifetime. The exact nature of these events can vary wildly, including social revolutions, alien invasions, the creation of a new form of art, and whatever else the players want to create and explore.

It uses a poker chip/Chit draw system for resolution.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Get it out the door PDF

boardgame.name: Heroic Talents: More Feats for Intrepid Adventurers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Old man? Talent comes with age, kid. You’d be lucky to be as old as me one day.”
— Akron Vess, Shatturan mercenary

The following is a new batch of feats that reflect how your adventurer is adapting to the world around them and growing their heroic spark.

As with all new play options, please consult your Game Master to verify that these feats mesh well with the vision and direction of their game.

This supplement includes:

7 new feats for your 5th edition game

boardgame.name: Aquatic Species Reforged
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of Star Log.EM includes: a complete refurbishment of how brenneris, kalos, and morlamaws function! Designed to be completely compatible with other Species Reforged products, ability adjustments are replaced with ability boosts and flaws and characters get a flexible list of species traits to choose from, earning additional trades as they grow in level. Additionally, all characters gain a special heritage that represents one of several different subgroups within their species.

boardgame.name: Goblin Pirates of the North Sea
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Th e goblins of the wasteland were not quick to take to the sea. It took many years before they were first recruited onto the ships of human pirates, and several generations before they were fully accepted by any of them. Once they finally overcame their disinclination toward maritime affairs and began running their own ships, however, goblins rapidly became the single most powerful criminal force to set sail upon the North Sea waters. The inland kingdoms hate and fear them, but these pirates have never tried to be loved. They can be useful at times, and they will strike deals with monarchs when it suits them to, but they keep faith with the pirate ideals of old and they have always refused to kneel.

The goblin pirates of today draw their members from all areas of goblinoid society. Mutants and orcs are treated the same as any other goblin, and even dark elves can feel at home if they do the job they are assigned. Some pirates even spend their whole lives from birth to death living on ships, where it takes skill to survive and divisions based on ancestry are not pressing political issues the way they are with the landlubbers. It may not be this way forever, but for now, the goal of these pirates is for goblins to rule the North Sea, not fight amongst themselves.

boardgame.name: GanjaLand
boardgame.description:
There are those that say, if you find yourself somewhere between myth and fantasy, and if you're really lucky (and high), you might be fortunate enough to discover GanjaLand.

How To Play.

Everyone smokes, passing to the left (according to GanjaLand tradition). Once the circle is complete. use the same order to take turns for the game.
The first person pulls a card from the deck and follows the card instructions, moving their character accordingly.
That turn is over and the used card is discarded and placed back in the box.
The game continues with each player/team drawing a new card from the deck.
The first player to land on the specified tile will win and be pronounced the King/Queen of GanjaLand, and can be referred to as his or her high-ness.

boardgame.name: Visiting the Watcher's Spire (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Adventurers coming to Languard in need of divine aid often make their way to the Watcher’s Spire. A place of Darlenite worship here the powers of law and good hold sway. Few are turned away from the Watcher’s Spire without receiving succour, but the clergy’s aid does not come free. Evil lurks everywhere and the priesthood are ever in need of champions to push back the encroaching darkness.

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, this urban locale is designed to help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This Urban Locale is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but is designed to be easily inserted into virtually any town or city.

boardgame.name: Visiting the Watcher's Spire (System Neutral Edition)
boardgame.description:

This Urban Locale is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but is designed to be easily inserted into virtually any town or city.

boardgame.name: Pirates of Pugmire
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

With the advent of the plastic hull, people of all species took to the Acid Sea to explore, seeking new shores and facing dangers unknown. Life on the sea is different than life in the relative safety of the kingdoms and monarchies. Sailors must face the dangers of hunger, starvation, or becoming hopelessly lost and adrift while the plastic hulls of their boats slowly melt into uselessness. Large portions of the sea remain unexplored and uncharted, denying pirates the assurance of a safe journey home. If treasure is found, there’s always a hostile crew or two out there on the waves, lying in wait to raid returning ships. And twisted corpses of dead sea life animated by Unseen forces haunt the waves. It takes an extra level of grit to brave the Acid Sea. Do you have what it takes?

Pirates of Pugmire is a chronicle sourcebook for both Pugmire and Monarchies of Mau. It’s usable with either game, or as part of a joint experience.

boardgame.name: Monstrous Arthropods
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Crack open this field guide to find ten terrifying creatures inspired by the unusual capabilities of animals from our own plane... Survive an ambush by a pair of orchid striker mantids; see the corpses of your friends animate under the fungal spores of the deathshaker; feel your flesh burn before the titanic blister colossus; and much more!

10 New Monsters for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

boardgame.name: Stats for Jesus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Pathfinder Stats for Jesus of Nazareth

In 1980, TSR Inc. published Deities and Demigods, which gave the game statistics for the gods of many real-world religious panthea.

With one rather notable exception.

boardgame.name: Legenden
Lost Omens: Legends
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
It's not always what you know, but who you know! The heroes of the Age of Lost Omens forge their path through an uncertain world, but that world has been shaped by many others who came before or who now stand beside them! Lost Omens: Legends provides details on 42 of the Inner Sea region's biggest personalities, from queens and kings that rule the present to distant figures from Golarion's past. Uncover details from the inner lives of movers and shakers from all around the globe, as well as the secret techniques, items, and knowledge PCs might gain from encountering these larger-than-life figures!

boardgame.name: Advanced Player's Guide (PF2)
Zusatzregeln
boardgame.description:
Ready to go beyond the basics? Expand the limits of what's possible with the Pathfinder Advanced Player's Guide! This 272-page Pathfinder Second Edition rulebook contains exciting new rules options for player characters, adding even more depth of choice to your Pathfinder game! Inside you will find brand new ancestries, heritages, and four new classes: the shrewd investigator, the mysterious oracle, the daring swashbuckler, and the hex-slinging witch! The must-have Advanced Player's Guide also includes exciting new options for all your favorite Core Rulebook classes and tons of new backgrounds, general feats, spells, items, and 40 flexible archetypes to customize your play experience even further!

The Pathfinder Advanced Player's Guide includes:


Four new classes: the investigator, oracle, swashbuckler, and witch!
Five new ancestries and five heritages for any ancestry: celestial aasimars, curious catfolk, hagspawned changelings, vampiric dhampirs, fate-touched duskwalkers, scaled kobolds, fierce orcs, fiendish tieflings, industrious ratfolk, and feathered tengu!
40 new archetypes including multiclass archetypes for the four new classes, Pathfinder favorites like the cavalier, dragon disciple, shadowdancer, and vigilante, and brand-new archetypes like the familiar master and the shield-bearing iron wall!
New class options for all twelve classes from the Pathfinder Core Rulebook including champions of evil, genie and shadow sorcerers, zen archer monks, rogue masterminds, spellcasting rangers, and more!
Even more exciting new rules, from rare and unique backgrounds to investigative skill feats, from spells and rituals like reincarnate and create demiplane to new items including special wands with unusual effects and exciting potions worthy of a witch's cauldron.

boardgame.name: Killers by Design
boardgame.description:
A guidebook for players who want to design their own custom "Killer" cards for the Psychos & Slashers games, Suburban Slasher and Kamp Killjoy. The instructions cover generating the various stats for the Killers plus a discussion of special powers, accompanied by examples. The expansion consists of a four-page folder and a blank Killer character/stats sheet.

—user summary

With the popularity and growth of Psychos & Slashers it seems inevitable that it should transcend the limitations of cards and boards, and that players should be able to move on into the strange borderland between straight strategy games and role-playing. The first step in that direction is a flexible system which allows players to design their own killers instead of having to rely on the traditional assortment presented in the various Psychos & Slashers games.

A customized Killer allows a player to explore his own sick imagination a bit more fully and adds variety and mystery to the game, while taking an important step closer to role-playing and inevitably [sic] release of the Psychos & Slashers role-playing game, though I suspect that when the RPG is released players will switch into the roles of victims rather than killers.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kamp Killjoy
Psychos & Slashers: Deluxe Set
Suburban Slasher

boardgame.name: Trinkets and Magical Curiosities of Ravenloft
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement introduces one hundred new trinkets that you may find on the demiplane of Ravenloft

The trinkets presented in this supplement are inspirited by the gothic horror genre and will bring an additional layer of depth to any Ravenloft or Curse of Strahd campaign. Many of the curiosities are designed as plot devices to inspire side quests and one-shot adventures in Ravenloft.

The Ravenloft is home to many cultures and the sheer volume of trinkets and curiosities to be found is Ravenloft is massive, and this supplement represents the merest fraction of what one can find on the demiplane of dread

boardgame.name: Brew & Fool!
boardgame.description:
In a far away kingdom, the King’s loyal Grand Alchemist has passed away. The King has personally requested for the best alchemists in the kingdom to brew the ultimate potion for him. The first alchemist to do so will be crowned the next Grand Alchemist. To speed up the process, the King has given each alchemist an equal chance to be appointed as the Royal Alchemist. The King ordered all the other alchemists to share their own Ingredients and findings with the Royal Alchemist to help each others’ progress. However, wanting to be the future and only Grand Alchemist, you will secretly sabotage the other alchemists using powerful spells while avoiding punishments from the King. Who will rise to the top to become the Grand Alchemist?

In the beginning, each player is dealt 1 Sabotage card which can be played an unlimited number of times and an assortment of Ingredients or Spells. Each round, a player has the chance to bear the Royal Emblem. The Royal Emblem denotes the Royal Alchemist, and all other players are instructed to give one ingredient to the Royal Alchemist. However, you can choose to sabotage by playing the Sabotage card or a Spell instead. As all the cards are played face down, nobody knows what anyone else is playing. The Royal Alchemist reveals all the cards and determines the fate accordingly.
There are 3 possible scenarios:

If half or more than half of the cards played are Ingredients: The Royal Alchemist collects all the Ingredients played and the spells will be cast.
If less than half of the cards played are Ingredients: The Royal Alchemist collects all Ingredients played and players who played Spells or Sabotage cards must instead give the Royal Alchemist any 2 cards from their hand. Spells will continue to be cast.
If all cards played are Ingredients: All Ingredients played are discarded instead.


During each round, players have the choice of depositing ingredients in their cauldron. Once in the cauldron, these ingredients cannot be returned to your hand. The first player to hold the Royal Emblem and have 10 or more ingredients of at least 6 different types in their cauldron wins the game. Alternatively, any player to collect 7 of the same ingredients in their cauldron instantly wins!

boardgame.name: Sfida tra opliti!
boardgame.description:
Marching in rows, hoplites from Sparta and Athens fight each other on a vaste plain. Whoever manages to outflank the enemy or sneak into their line will bring havoc!
A themed version of Apit-Sodok.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #3.

boardgame.name: Brothers at War: 6mm ACW Wargame Rules
boardgame.description:
Brothers at War is wargame system to land battles in the American Civil War (ACW) on 6mm to 20mm scale.
The basic fighting unit is a company or a battery of artilley. These are grouped into divisions.
Turns are performed by alternate activation of divisions, with the quality of the commanders determining some issues.

Basic unit types are: infantry, cavalry, artillery and special units (General, Officer, Banner, Skirmisher).
Points system for units and army lists for points based games.
The army lists can be used to convert historical orders of battle, into lists for games.

The objective is to provide an easy, agile and adaptable rules system for the simulation of combat in the American Civil War.
The definitions of range of weapons were based on historical sources and serious publications, in particular the book “Small Arms at Gettysburg”, by Joseph G. Bilby.
Likewise, the rules for combat formations and for the historical characteristics of each army were also the target of research in specialized bibliography on the subject.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Verflixter Wettbewerb
boardgame.description:
Published by a car paint manufacturer, all players compete to be the best car paint garage. On his turn, a player may choose 1 of 3 options:

Buy up to 2 investment or cooperation tiles or perfomance stars
Roll the die and move one of the 4 cars on the board track and - according to the space landed on - draw a mission card, an action card, an event card or do nothing. The mission cards give rewards, the more, the better you meet the required conditions (have stars and the right tiles).
Play an action card against an opponent.


If a player has completed his garage table with 6 investment tiles, 3 cooperation tiles and 6 perfomance stars, the game ends. The player with the most valuable garage wins.

Produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion Service.

—user summary

listing.notes: Game is complete, components unpunched, cards in shrink, parts in closed bags Payments: bank account or Paypal If you want to pay by Paypal, there will be an additional fee German

boardgame.name: Tyr's Treasure
boardgame.description:
A gambling game created to be used inside of fantasy role playing games as a plot hook, but it can also be played as a stand alone game. Players roll custom metal dice with special symbols replacing the 1's. Depending on the roll, they might pay into the pot, take from the pot, or be eliminated entirely. The last player in the game takes the entire pot.

From the rulebook:

Tyr's Treasure is a game of chance for use with any Role-Playing System. The rules are designed for 1-6 players. The game is played with two handmade brass six-sided dice that are cast across your favorite tavern table.

Some like knuckle bones, Troll's Teeth, or Dragon Scales, and the Coastal folk prefer Golem's Gambit, but warriors abroad love the chance and excitement of Tyr's Treasure.

boardgame.name: Golem's Gambit
boardgame.description:
A gambling game created to be used inside of fantasy role playing games as a plot hook, but it can also be played as a stand alone game.

The game uses six custom metal four-sided dice, each showing two blanks, one x, and one double x. Players roll all the dice, re-rolling single x's until all dice are blank or double x. Then the blanks are discarded, and the player makes one final roll with the remaining dice to find out of they multiply their winnings or lose it all.

The game is weighted in favor of the player.

boardgame.name: Troll's Teeth
boardgame.description:
A gambling game created to be used inside of fantasy role playing games as a plot hook, but it can also be played as a stand alone game.

The game uses six custom metal 4-sided dice, each with two blanks and two faces showing a single pip. The players make a wager, roll the dice, and either lose their wager, multiply their wager, or keep their wager based on the result.

The game is weighted in favor of the player, but the rules include variants that greatly reduce the advantage.

boardgame.name: Snekagon
boardgame.description:
Snekagon is a 7-turn abstract perfect information game about building snakes.

The goal of the game is to create a snake longer than your opponent by placing tiles of various shapes.

On your turn, you can place one tile either so that it doesn't touch any other tile, thus creating a new snake. The other option is to place the tile so that it touches some of your other tiles - this way, you make one of your snakes grow. You can even connect two of your snakes this way!

Starship Operations Manual

Back of the Book

BLAST OFF!

Your odds of surviving the galaxy's threats are only as good as your starship. The Starship Operations Manual powers up your starship. with exciting new options.


New armaments like plasma mines, ramming prows, orbital lasers, and electronic countermeasures.



Alternate armor and starship systems like deflector shields, virtual intelligences, and holographic mantles.



Ways for your PCs to pilot a squadron of starships -- or direct massive armadas as commanding officers.



Details for dozens of starship manufacturers and stats for the most influential starship designs.



Advice and tools for GMs building starship campaigns!

boardgame.name: Polizisten & Vigilanten
boardgame.description:
Publisher description:

Mit Waffengewalt kann man gegen die Schrecken des Mythos kaum etwas ausrichten. Aber sie sind nicht die einzige Bedrohung in der Welt. Im Kampf gegen diese Gefahren setzen staatliche Kräfte wie der Sheriff oder der Forensiker und ebenso „freiberufliche“ wie das Mitglied einer Bürgerwehr oder der Maskierte Rächer nicht nur auf detektivischen Spürsinn, sondern auch auf handfeste Argumente. So versuchen sie, das Recht durchzusetzen, auch wenn nicht immer klar ist, ob das vermeintlich Legitime auch legal ist. Während die Investigatoren noch grübeln, was das Richtige ist, zerplatzen die philosophischen Blasen angesichts des Mythos. Ob Flinte, Messer oder Kampfkunst - was kann dann noch helfen?

Mit Polizisten & Vigilanten liegt der vierte Berufeband für Cthulhu vor, der sich gezielt an die Spieler richtet. Er ergänzt das Investigatoren-Kompendium mit ganz neuen Berufen für Investigatoren aus der Welt der offiziellen und inoffiziellen Verbrechensbekämpfung. Welche Durchsetzungsmöglichkeiten standen ihnen zur Verfügung? Welche Ermittlungsmethoden setzen sie ein? Sind es wirklich hehre Motive, die sie auf diesen Weg geführt haben? Denn nicht immer ist das Recht gerecht.
Hier finden Cthulhu-Spieler umfangreiche Hintergründe, Anregungen und Spielmechanismen zur Erschaffung und Ausgestaltung von Polizisten und Vigilanten als Investigatoren.

boardgame.name: Desert World
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

IT'S GETTING HOT OUT THERE!

Whether the heroes are prospecting for rare resources on a scorched, lifeless planet or looking for a hermit with knowledge of ancient solarian techniques, a Game Master could spend lots of time drawing every sand dune and rocky outcrop. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. This double-sided map features a sunbaked sea of sandy dunes on one side and a landscape of barren rock badlands on the other.

Spend less time sketching and more time playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Desert World, you'll always be ready next time your players want some sun and sand!

A special coating on each Flip-Mat allows you to use wet erase, dry erase, AND permanent markers with ease! Removing permanent ink is easy—simply trace over any permanent mark with a dry erase marker, wait 10 seconds, then wipe off both marks with a dry cloth or paper towel.

boardgame.name: AMP GM Screen

boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

boardgame.name: Das Zeitungsspiel
boardgame.description:
The players are reporters and want to collect 8 articles for their newspaper. On your turn, you throw 2 dice. The colored die determines what kind of card you are entitled to draw onto your hand. Blue cards show a specific department, grew ones a specific action like swap cards, play a department card from your hand into your display, make a revealed card of an opponent a canard (worthless), decide to accelerate before throwing the dice. The regular die determines the number of spaces you advance on the track.

You may play one action card on your turn. When you have 8 cards in your display, try to reach the space of the head quarter. After someone arrived there, all players add the value of their cards in their display and deduct the number of spaces they need to reach the headquarter. Highest score wins.

There are several German newspapers that published this game idea.

The game is produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.

boardgame.name: Sea Hunt
boardgame.description:
"Based on the exciting T.V. adventure series"

A simple roll and move game for four people. Players move their diver figure, descending from the surface to a shipwreck on the sea bed. A treasure chest is collected from the ship's strong room and carried back to a boat on the surface to win the game. There are a number of hazards to overcome along the way.

The game was produced to tie in with the popular T.V. adventure series of the same name, starring Lloyd Bridges.

boardgame.name: Song for War: Mediterranean Theater
boardgame.description:
November…1942. World War 2 ravages the globe in a bloody conflict for the very soul of humankind. Across the war-torn regions of the Mediterranean, the Axis powers of Germany and Italy control much of the theater. But the mighty nations of the United States and Great Britain are on the move, launching a massive offensive —code-named Operation Torch.

But where will the secret Allied fleet choose to land its assault? Will they reclaim air superiority, control the sea, and gain a foothold in the underbelly of Axis-held Europe, or will Axis forces repel the Allies back in a storm of blood and fire?

Song for War: Mediterranean Theater is a tabletop strategy game based in the contested regions of southern Europe, north Africa, and the Mediterranean Sea during World War 2. Representing one of four nations, players must work together as the Allies (US or Great Britain) or Axis (Germany or Italy). Players have the option to set strategy, move units, attack and defend as individual nations or simultaneously as the Allied or Axis team. Innovative mechanics allow players to deploy their land, sea, and air units strategically as combined forces, with faster units moving first and more often, followed by heavy units with stronger firepower. Take strategic objectives, control shipping lanes and resupply, deploy new technologies and units, and recreate historical events to defeat the enemy and win the day.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ターンアップシャーク (TURN UP SHARK)
boardgame.description:
ターンアップシャーク～超B級サメ坊主めくり！～ (Tan-appu shaku - cho B kyu same bozumekuri! - )(Turn-up Shark - Super B-movie Shark Card Game!! -) is a card game from Japan.

Death comes when the power of sharks goes over the limit!
Handy and easy, but super-exciting!
Escape from the sharks that hunt you anywhere!
Sometimes, make counter-attack with weapons!!

A diabolical-modified Bonzu mekuri*! Players are characters in a Sharknado style movie. A player draws only 1 or 2 cards a turn. If they get overwhelmed by sharks, they die! But weapon cards help the players survive.


Bonzu mekuri is a historic card game in Japan, which consists of flipping cards and holding or collecting cards, or going bust.
